SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.controller.timer

Class TurnTimerController

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.controller.timer.TurnTimerController
public class TurnTimerController extends Object
The TurnTimerController delivers an interface that can be used to control the timers of a turn. Exposing only the start and stop methods this class lets the user set up timers for an entire turn without any method to reset when needed.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    TurnTimerController()
    Constructs a TurnTimerController with an associated thread pool and an empty map of timers.

  • Constructor Details

  • Method Details

    • startTimer

      public void startTimer(Player currPlayer, int turnTimeSeconds, int pingTimeSeconds)
      Starts a timer for the specified player with the given turn time and ping time.

      This method initializes a new TurnTimer for the given player and schedules it to run using an ExecutorService. The timer will send ping messages at specified intervals and will keep track of the turn duration.

      Parameters:
      currPlayer - The player whose turn is starting.
      turnTimeSeconds - The duration of the turn in seconds.
      pingTimeSeconds - The interval between ping messages in seconds.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the turn time or ping time is non-positive.

    • startTimer

      public void startTimer(Player player, int turnTimeSeconds)
      Starts a timer for the specified player with the given turn time and default ping time.

      This method behaves similarly to startTimer(Player, int, int), but uses a default ping time of 20 seconds.

      Parameters:
      player - The player whose turn is starting.
      turnTimeSeconds - The duration of the turn in seconds.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the turn time is non-positive.

    • stopTimer

      public void stopTimer(Player player)
      Stops the player timer if running
      Parameters:
      player - the player whose turn has finished

    • startAll

      public void startAll(List<Player> playerList, int turnTime)
      Starts timers for all players in the given list with the specified turn time and default ping time.

      This method iterates over the list of players and starts a timer for each using the default ping time of 20 seconds.

      Parameters:
      playerList - The list of players whose turns are starting.
      turnTime - The duration of each turn in seconds.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the turn time is non-positive.

    • startAll

      public void startAll(List<Player> playerList, int turnTime, int pingTimeSeconds)
      Starts timers for all players in the given list with the specified turn time and ping time.

      This method iterates over the list of players and starts a timer for each using the specified turn time and ping time.

      Parameters:
      playerList - The list of players whose turns are starting.
      turnTime - The duration of each turn in seconds.
      pingTimeSeconds - The interval between ping messages in seconds.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the turn time or ping time is non-positive.

    • stopAll

      public void stopAll()
      Stops all running timers for players.
